intro: Argemone mexicana var. gynophora, commonly known as the Mexican prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and spiny, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
